column5: Hey guys, i was just going through some of my pictures from this fall and thought that I would share some of my bass photos with you all. We had an amazing fall this year chasing bass but November in particular was a great month with a couple of 50 fish days. Slowing down presentations was key to getting good hook ups. Senkos, Jig n Pigs and even Jerk baits all produced fish. We witnessed the "fall feedbag phenominon" at its finest. The bass seemed to be schooled up pretty good. When we found one we found many. Sorry for the late report but I suppose that its better late than never. Good luck to all the guys on the hardwater this season. Enjoy the pics.
WOWW!!!  Awesome Report and Pics!!!!  Thanks for sharing.
Finally get to see your fall bass report..... UNBELIEVABLE SMB's & LMB's galore  Great job msp!!!     Looks like you have your own piece of bass paradise!!! Thanks for sharing Leechman
Excellent pictures and buckets, I'll get the hang of Fall bassin for next year...sick of those skinny summer bass, I want a 18" fish to weigh 4lbs lol   Great job, MTBF
Those fish are beautiful! What region or area are they from?
Nice Looking Fish & great report Richard
nice job mike..any of them there fish on the jigs you got from me????
So the stories are true, and here I thought Telly was recounting some impossibly fantastic dreams.......lol  Nice feeeesh Mike, hopefully we can get together on the ice, or perhaps a river.   Dan

"Those fish are beautiful! What region or area are they from?" The largies are from the Kawarthas and the smallies are from Haliburton.   "nice job mike..any of them there fish on the jigs you got from me????" Sorry Todd, I wish that I could say yes but I had a bad rust incident this summer. I lost about 20 jigs. Let me know if you will have any more available before bass season starts next year. I love the custom colours you and your brother make!!!!
let me know what you want and I'll do some more up for you!
Wow...some real nice fish there!  Congrats on a great fall season this year.
